conversations.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<function_thought>
I need to follow the initialized function trajectory plan. The first step is to use `list_directory` to explore the `/system/.ssh` directory to locate the public SSH key file.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[list_directory(path="/system/.ssh")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<function_thought>
The directory contains two files: 'id_rsa' (private key) and 'id_rsa.pub' (public key). Since we need to add the public SSH key to the GitHub account, I should read the content of 'id_rsa.pub'.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have obtained the public SSH key content. The next step is to add this SSH key to the GitHub account using the `git_add_ssh_key` function.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]</function_call>

<final_answer>
I have successfully added your public SSH key to your GitHub account.
